content.description: Sit start on two pockets and climb the tall face on a variety of cool edges and pinches.  Be careful of loose rock as not everything has been tested, would be quite good if it wasn't so sandy.
content.location: Tucked away near fools gold.  Facing the front side of the fang boulder, should be visible if you turn right and start walking up the hillside

content.description: Start standing on two good edges.  Good quality rock, but a bad landing that can't really be padded.  Fun and short.
content.location: On the same boulder as worms eat dirt, on the face around the corner to the left of worms.

content.description: Sit start on a right hand slot and a small lower left hand pocket, on the nice patina face on the rim of the canyon up and left from worms eat dirt.  Easy to see on your right as you're walking in to Moes.
content.location: On the rim of the canyon on the right side as you're walking in

content.description:
Cool climbing on cool holds, and snaking your way through the crack, especially if you have done most other stuff around here.

There's a sit start on this one - start left hand on sandy sidepull, right heel on, and right hand in an incut jug, and work up right, then into the cool finish (v6)

A lot of people start on the right pinch at waist height, and a left sidepull on the left, and that's also fun, and a little easier (but you still get to do the cool topout, which is the crux).
content.protection: 2 pads is nice to have, but you can prob get away with one.
content.location: This is the only line on this boulder, which is accessed via a slot on your way towards the rocks behind Fang.

content.description: Climb the arete left of worms eat dirt starting on a low left undercling and a pinch.  Be really careful up top, there are some hollow jugs that could come off and the landing is bad.
content.location: Arete left of worms eat dirt
